SENTENCE.STRING: is the capital city of North Korea, located on the Taedong River, at 39°02'N,125°45'E (39.0333, 125.75).
is not disclosed; given as 2,741,260 in 1993, it was reported as 2.5 and 3.8 million in 2002 and 2003 by Chosen Soren, a pro-North Korean organization.
was split from the South P'yŏngan province in 1946.
is administered as a Directly Governed City (Chikhalsi), on the same level as provincial governments, not a Special City (Teukbyeolsi) as Seoul is in South Korea.
Some sources, mostly older and South Korean, refer to
as a Special City, but it has been reported that even the South Korean government adopted the Directly Governed City terminology in 1994.
